name: permissibly
content:

in a way that is allowed: An employer might permissibly dismiss any employee who posed a danger to other workers. I cannot imagine any circumstances under which nuclear weapons could permissibly be used.
More examplesFewer examplesThe land is not protected by environmental legislation and could permissibly be built on.In the ancient world, anybody who had been declared an outlaw could permissibly be killed.The officer's search of the car permissibly included unlocking the boot to check it for weapons.
